data.title: Either Blake Lively or Kristen Stewart Is Woody Allen‘s New Muse
data.meta_description: Two more ingenues follow in Emma Stone and Scarlett Johansson’s footsteps.
data.text:
Woody Allen, despite everything, still knows how to assemble a cast that makes us stand up and pay attention. And even with an Amazon TV series on the horizon, he’s still sticking to his regular schedule of making a film every year. The cast for his latest effort, still untitled and now filming in New York and Los Angeles, will bring two much-beloved-in-the-V.F.-office faces to the Allen universe: scowling sweetheart Kristen Stewart and lifestyle guru Blake Lively.

Those two are listed in the main cast lineup—alongside Jeannie Berlin, Jesse Eisenberg, Parker Posey, Corey Stoll, Ken Stott, and Bruce Willis—while Anna Camp and Paul Schneider are included in the list of “co-stars.” That’s the only clue we get to the size of each actor’s respective role in the film, which, if Allen tradition dictates, will premiere sometime next spring or summer. But look at what Allen has done for up-and-coming actresses in the past! Either Lively or Stewart could be his new Emma Stone, or Scarlett Johansson, or hell, Dianne Wiest. We may be looking back years from now, after Blake Lively accepts her Oscar and name-checks Cate Blanchett, as the moment we all learned that underestimating The Age of Adaline was a fatal mistake. Or we’ll lump this in with Stewart’s Cesar Award win and present this casting announcement as part of “the Kristen Stewart epoch.”

Or, this movie could turn out like Magic in the Moonlight or Irrational Man and vanish from our memories the moment it comes out. With Allen, you really never know.
